programme.title: Tsunami 2004: The Day the Wave Hit
programme.desc: Part one of two. A minute-by-minute account of the December 2004 tsunami, which destroyed towns and villages across the Indian Ocean, killing 230,000. Among those sharing their personal experiences of the disaster are a hotelier who was recently married and three months pregnant at the time, and a man travelling by train who was forced to climb on top of the carriage to escape

programme.title: Tsunami 2004: The Day the Wave Hit
programme.desc: Part two of two. Holidaymakers share their experiences of the disaster, including a woman who was separated from her family on the beach, witnessing the death of her son, a couple whose bungalow was destroyed, and a family that fled to higher ground when their hotel was destroyed

programme.title: Ramsay's 24 Hours to Hell and Back
programme.desc: Gordon and his team attempt to revamp a seafood restaurant in Manquin, Virginia, a town near the beach that's popular with fishermen. But it has one of the most disgusting kitchens Gordon has ever seen

programme.title: Swiped: The School That Banned Smartphones
programme.desc: Emma Willis and Matt Willis join forces with The Stanway School in Colchester as they challenge a group of Year 8 pupils, and themselves, to give up their smartphones completely for 21 days. As parents, Matt and Emma have become increasingly concerned about the impact smartphones are having on their kids and are keen to find out if excessive smartphone use is affecting children's mental and physical health. This experiment, conducted in conjunction with The University of York, will see the pupils undergo a series of tests with experts, meticulously monitoring their behavioural changes over the 21 days, repeating the tests at the end of the three weeks to assess what effects giving up phones really has on the brain - including sleep and attention. Will locking away the devices make the kids happier, healthier and more ready to learn? And will this experiment prove that smartphones should be banned until at least the age of 14?

programme.title: Undercover Boss Canada
programme.desc: Matthew Corrin, CEO of health-food company Freshii, poses as a new member of staff among employees at his franchise's outlets in a bid to assess how well the business is being run. As he goes behind the scenes, he finds out whether workers are observing the business's core values, and also discovers how to prevent unnecessary waste

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: Henry Cole and Simon O'Brien restore a metal workbench, a pine chest and the seat from an old pony and trap

programme.title: Frasier
programme.desc: Niles and Daphne impulsively marry while holidaying in Reno, but on their return they realise Frasier, Martin and Daphne's mother will be distraught if they find out they missed the event. Starring David Hyde Pierce and Jane Leeves

programme.title: Frasier
programme.sub-title: Enemy at the Gate Season 10, Episode 2
programme.desc: The Crane brothers confront an unscrupulous car-park attendant over a matter of principle - and two dollars. Meanwhile, Daphne leaves Frasier's home for the last time, and realises how much Eddie and Martin are going to miss her. Kelsey Grammer stars

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.sub-title: Simpsons Roasting on an Open Fire Season 1, Episode 1
programme.desc: Homer's hopes for a merry Christmas are dashed by Mr Burns' refusal to pay a holiday bonus, so he decides to earn extra cash by getting a job as a department store Santa Claus. First-ever episode of the long-running animated comedy series

programme.title: Countdown
programme.desc: Colin Murray and Rachel Riley host as contestants race against the clock to pit their wits against words and numbers. Christopher Biggins is in Dictionary Corner with Susie Dent

programme.title: Cheers
programme.sub-title: How to Recede in Business Season 7, Episode 1
programme.desc: Rebecca is fired and replaced as manager by Sam - who generously rehires her but fails to make it clear there are strings attached. Comedy, starring Ted Danson and Kirstie Alley

programme.title: Cheers
programme.desc: Sam finds out an ex-girlfriend's child might be his and swears an oath of celibacy to preclude the possibility of siring any more unwanted heirs. Ted Danson stars

programme.title: Cheers
programme.desc: Part one of two. Rebecca rebuffs Sam and tells him that in future she'll only date men who can advance her career. Ted Danson stars

programme.title: The King of Queens
programme.desc: Carrie is made unemployed and initially shows no inclination to find another job. Finally stung into action by a confrontation with Doug, she decides to join Arthur in a new business venture - making mobile phone covers

programme.title: The King of Queens
programme.desc: The Heffernans reminisce about moving into their house 10 years previously - and recall how Carrie had a tough job convincing a reluctant Doug, who was opposed to the change

programme.title: The King of Queens
programme.desc: Arthur wins $2,500 at a bingo game, but his decision to share part of his winnings with Doug and Carrie comes with its own set of rules - he will decide how they spend it. American comedy, starring Kevin James, Leah Remini and Jerry Stiller

programme.title: Frasier
programme.sub-title: They're Playing Our Song Season 7, Episode 13
programme.desc: The shrink pulls out all the stops to compose a new theme tune for his radio show - but fails to appreciate what is required. Comedy, starring Kelsey Grammer and David Hyde Pierce

programme.title: Frasier
programme.sub-title: Big Crane on Campus Season 7, Episode 14
programme.desc: The shrink is delighted to land a date with a former prom queen, but soon learns the hard way that beauty is only skin deep. Comedy, starring Kelsey Grammer and David Hyde Pierce

programme.title: Frasier
programme.desc: An unlikely sequence of events culminates in Martin pretending to be gay on Valentine's Day. Comedy, starring Kelsey Grammer and John Mahoney

programme.title: Frasier
programme.sub-title: Something About Dr Mary Season 7, Episode 16
programme.desc: A temporary call-screener steals the show with her own brand of no-nonsense advice, leaving Frasier feeling insecure. Comedy, starring Kelsey Grammer

programme.title: Channel 4 News Summary
programme.desc: Channel 4's midday news summary

programme.title: A Christmas Carousel
programme.desc: Schoolteacher Lila is hired by the royal family of Ancadia to restore a carousel as a surprise for Prince Whitaker's niece, and she works with him to complete it in time for Christmas. As the restoration progresses, so does te pair's friendship, and they soon realise they have things in common. Romantic drama, starring Rachel Boston and Neal Bledsoe

programme.title: Jamie's Christmas Shortcuts
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver shows how to enjoy Christmas without blowing the budget. In this episode, he shares his need-to-know recipes for a spectacular Christmas Day feast, from his foolproof guide to the ultimate roast turkey to a showstopping veggie centrepiece and stuffing that will please meat-eaters and vegetarians alike. Plus, Jamie shows us his shortcuts for perfect roast potatoes

programme.title: Countdown
programme.desc: Colin Murray and Rachel Riley host the long-running words and numbers game. Christopher Biggins is in Dictionary Corner with Susie Dent

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Ben Hillman meets Allie and Cliff who are looking to buy a new permanent residence on the Greek island of Crete with a budget of £240,000

programme.title: Chateau DIY
programme.desc: At Chateau de la Boutiniere, Alison and Zion are hoping to complete an ensuite before Christmas and in the Pyrenees, Trish prepares for her first culinary workshop with a Michelin-starred chef. Jon and Carmen hold a festive medieval banquet

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The B&Bers are in Bath for the week's second visit, at Hill House. Hosts Tina and Alex plunge their guests into the famous city's history. But parking problems and a big old climb to the hotel's hilltop location mean it doesn't hit the heights for everyone

programme.title: Kirstie's Handmade Christmas
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp offers festive tips on how to have a stylish Christmas without breaking the bank. Embracing the wintery theme, Kirstie is let loose on a block of ice with power tools, before going inside to learn one of this year's hottest new crafting trends. In the kitchen, Kirstie overcomes her fear of making pastry, with a decadent choux pastry wreath, and shows that craft and cooking go hand in hand with Christmas crackers made from pasta. She also serves up a boozy hot chocolate and demonstrates how to turn lonely old socks into fun festive friends

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.sub-title: She of Little Faith Season 13, Episode 6
programme.desc: Mr Burns takes over the running of the local church and turns it into a profitable business, prompting a disgusted Lisa to leave the congregation in protest and become a Buddhist instead. Featuring the guest voice of Richard Gere

programme.title: Channel 4 News
programme.desc: Channel 4's flagship news programme. With sport and weather

programme.title: The Great Celebrity Bake Off for Stand Up to Cancer
programme.desc: Matt Lucas and Noel Fielding invite Paddy McGuinness, Coleen Nolan, Joe Thomas and Ellie Taylor into the tent to face three challenges set by judges Paul Hollywood and Prue Leith. The contestants are asked to make Jaffa cakes, take the rough with the smooth in the pastry Technical, and render their home towns in biscuit for their showstoppers

programme.title: Hotel Chocolat at Christmas
programme.desc: Behind the scenes with the staff at Hotel Chocolat as they prepare for the festive season. New chocolatier Sammie is thrown in at the deep end, crafting new chocolates including her complicated three-layered cranberry treat. Store manager Steph in Chelmsford takes on the task of turning the whole shop from Halloween to Christmas overnight. The marketing team put together an immersive 3D advertisement and have photoshoots for advent calendars in July. As Christmas approaches, the team take the 'chocmobile' on the road to one of the country's best light shows to tempt cold visitors with samples of their limited edition alcoholic mint-chocolate drink

programme.title: Gogglebox
programme.desc: Highlights from the first 10 years of the show, looking back at how a nation survived lockdowns, a revolving door of prime ministers, and Ed Balls dancing Gangnam Style on Strictly. Featuring appearances by old faces Steph and Dom, Leon and June, and Sandra and Sandi, current armchair critics Pete and Sophie, Mary and Giles, Jenny and Lee, and the Siddiquis, who have been on Gogglebox since it all started

programme.title: Gogglebox
programme.desc: The armchair critics appraise shows including You Bet!, Black Doves, Jamie Cooks Christmas, Wolf Hall: The Mirror and the Light, The 1% Club and A Nonsense Christmas with Sabrina Carpenter

programme.title: Jimmy Carr's I Literally Just Told You
programme.desc: AJ Odudu, Ben Shephard, Bill Bailey and Sarah Millican compete in this special edition of the game show, where questions are written live, based on things that have just been seen or heard. All the contenders need to do is remember the answers that host Jimmy Carr, his team of question writers and some surprise guests have literally just told them

programme.title: Junior Taskmaster
programme.sub-title: You Can't Milk a Pigeon Season 1, Episode 6
programme.desc: Contestants - all aged between nine and 11 - are on tenterhooks as they compete in the first semi-final. Junior Taskmaster Rose Matafeo scrutinises their every move and loyal assistant Mike Wozniak has even combed his moustache for the occasion. The hopefuls perform a poem about their favourite celebrity and recount some secrets to a milkman called Mark

programme.title: The Last Leg
programme.desc: Adam Hills, Josh Widdicombe and Alex Brooker are joined by guests Jameela Jamil, Fin Taylor and Richard Ayoade for a comic review of the significant moments of the past seven days. As usual, the hashtag #isitok paves the way for the gang to round up, examine and explain the leading and most entertaining news stories of the week

programme.title: Swiped: The School That Banned Smartphones
programme.desc: The second of two programmes in which Matt and Emma Willis tackle the impact of smartphones on children's behaviour with a pioneering social experiment that sees a group of Year 8 pupils at the Stanway School in Colchester - and themselves - give up their smartphones for 21 days. This experiment, conducted in conjunction with the University of York, sees the pupils undergo a series of tests with experts, monitoring their behavioural changes over the duration, repeating the tests at the end of the three weeks to assess what effects giving up a phone has on the brain - including sleep and attention

programme.title: Frasier
programme.desc: The shrink hopes to become the new condominium president and tries to ensure he is elected by persuading an unsuspecting Martin to stand as a 'puppet' candidate. American comedy, starring Kelsey Grammer and John Mahoney

programme.title: Frasier
programme.desc: Roz's fun-loving 20-year-old cousin visits Seattle, and Frasier finds himself struggling to keep pace with her partying. Meanwhile, Martin has trouble coping without Daphne. Long-running American comedy, guest starring Zooey Deschanel (New Girl)

programme.title: Frasier
programme.sub-title: Tales from the Crypt Season 10, Episode 5
programme.desc: Bulldog plays a practical joke on Frasier, who wastes no time in plotting revenge. Meanwhile, Niles and Daphne get caught up in a battle with a doorstep trick-or-treater. Comedy, starring Kelsey Grammer and David Hyde Pierce

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.sub-title: Skinner's Sense of Snow Season 12, Episode 8
programme.desc: A snowstorm leaves Bart, Lisa and their fellow students trapped inside Springfield Elementary and it is not long before the pupils are running amok. Homer and Ned Flanders are left to mount the rescue operation to save the kids - and Principal Skinner

programme.title: Countdown
programme.desc: Colin Murray and Rachel Riley host the long-running words and numbers game. Christopher Biggins is in Dictionary Corner with Susie Dent

programme.title: Cheers
programme.sub-title: One Happy Chappy in a Snappy Serape Season 7, Episode 4
programme.desc: Part two of two. Rebecca faces a dilemma after she is forced to choose her man, and has difficulty deciding whether Martin or Sam will prove to be the lesser of two evils. Bar-room comedy, guest starring Alex Nevil, with Ted Danson and Kirstie Alley

programme.title: Cheers
programme.sub-title: Those Lips, Those Ice Season 7, Episode 5
programme.desc: Cliff, Norm, and Frasier vie for the honour of accompanying Woody to a football game, while Carla convinces herself Eddie is having an affair with a beautiful skater appearing with him in the ice show. American bar-room comedy, starring Rhea Perlman and Kelsey Grammer

programme.title: Cheers
programme.sub-title: Norm, Is That You? Season 7, Episode 6

programme.desc: The latest reports

programme.title: Supermarket Own-Brands: The Big Taste Test
programme.desc: Comparing big brand Christmas products to more affordable ones with a series of taste tests to see if the knock offs can knock out the heavyweight brands. In the Good Food studio, food scientist Amir takes a look inside a few puddings to see how the supermarkets can compete with the likes of Fortnum and Mason. Plus, investigating how supermarkets make their festive treats so cheap

programme.title: The Good Ship Murder
programme.desc: The holiday season is off to a rocky start when the luxury ship's resident Santa falls ill, threatening to disappoint the passengers. Bev puts Jack in charge of finding a replacement Santa and his search leads him to Buddy, a veteran comedian in Dubrovnik, who seems like the perfect fit. However, unexpected events complicate Jack's plan, leaving everyone scrambling to save Christmas on board

programme.title: Body at the Bottom of the Ocean: The Murder of Ronald Platt
programme.desc: In 1966, a man's body was washed up in a fishing net off the south coast of Devon. The victim was wearing an expensive Rolex watch with a unique serial number, enabling police to identify him. But the case took a strange turn with the discovery of a second man who was very much alive but with the same name - and wanted by Interpol

programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc: On the A1, officers battle to stop a dangerous driver from careering down the carriageway in 18 tons of stolen lorry. After a successful strike with a heavy-duty stinger, the driver carries on until he runs out of road and takes his chances on foot. but he crosses the path of two security dogs on duty with their handler. Meanwhile, in Sutton-in-Ashfield, firearms cops Richard and Ash are forced to use the big red key when a wanted man refuses to open the door, and over in Hucknall, the results of a roadworthy check don't go down too well.

programme.title: Motorway Cops: Catching Britain's Speeders
programme.desc: Storms bring travel chaos to the roads and Inspector Anton Sullivan braces against the weather as he attends a major incident in Runcorn where a roof has blown off and collapsed. In Northwich, PC Mike Clark pulls over a suspected drug driver, who pleads his case as a medical cannabis user, while PC Clark responds to a call for urgent backup from PC Niaz Waddington, who has been attacked on duty

She also travels to Cagnes-sur-Mer to visit the former home of impressionist painter Pierre-Auguste Renoir, where his studio is preserved as a museum

programme.desc: In this updated film, Alexis Conran and chef Miguel Barclay lift the lid on the air fryer's festive magic. From succulent turkey and crisp roasties to indulgent desserts and clever ways to transform leftovers, they guide viewers through every dish you need for a flawless spread. Plus, celebrity guests including John Partridge and Vanessa Feltz share their tips for festive cookery

programme.title: 5 News Update
programme.desc: National and international news

programme.title: Inside the Tower of London
programme.desc: Summer, and the Beefeater-led tours run throughout the day, draw hundreds of visitors at a time. New Beefeater Barney Barnett spent 25 years in the Royal Navy, but getting his head around the huge script - covering 1,000 years of Tower history - is a whole new challenge. Meanwhile, Tower Governor Brigadier Andrew Jackson plans the Tudor Pull, a 25-mile river journey with 18 rowing boats carrying ceremonial objects

programme.title: Dalgliesh
programme.sub-title: Devices and Desires - Part One Season 3, Episode 5
programme.desc: In Kent, the local community is rocked by a string of killings committed by the so-called 'Whistler'. Since every victim is found to work at Larkskill Nuclear Power Station, Dalgliesh is sent to investigate a possible political motive. Drama, starring starring Bertie Carvel

programme.title: Prime Suspect: Who Killed Diane Jones?
programme.desc: Robert Jones was the GP in the Essex town of Coggeshall, where he lived with his 35-year-old wife Diane. They first met as doctor and patient and started an affair, but in July 1983, Diane vanished. Three months later her body was discovered in woodland. Suspicion centred on her husband again and again, but he was never charged. This documentary uses new evidence from detectives, friends, lovers and neighbours to reveal Diane Jones's secrets and how she and her upstanding doctor husband lived a life that was nothing like it appeared

programme.title: Killer at the Crime Scene
programme.desc: A decomposing human corpse is found in a suitcase dumped on a country lane in Yorkshire. The investigation's first clue is the distinctively patterned tape used to bind the victim

programme.title: Bad Teacher
programme.desc: Cynical, hard-drinking teacher Elizabeth Halsey hates her job and the kids in her class, and hopes to escape her daily grind by landing a rich husband. A wealthy substitute seems like a suitable candidate, but she has a rival for his attention in a squeaky-clean colleague. Comedy, starring Cameron Diaz, Justin Timberlake, Jason Segel and Lucy Punch

programme.title: Gift Horse
programme.desc: A Navy captain reluctantly takes command of an old US destroyer during the Second World War and struggles with a crew who do not respect his authority. However, the prospect of facing the mighty German force brings much-needed unity. Adventure, starring Trevor Howard, Richard Attenborough, Bernard Lee, Sonny Tufts and James Donald

programme.title: Sink the Bismarck!
programme.desc: Fact-based Second World War drama, charting the mission to track down and eliminate the pride of the German fleet, a fearsome battleship devastating British vessels in the North Atlantic, orchestrated by a British naval officer recovering from his wife's death in an air raid. Starring Kenneth More, Dana Wynter, Laurence Naismith and Karel Stepanek

programme.title: The Mask of Zorro
programme.desc: The sword-wielding saviour of Spanish California returns after 20 years in prison, tutoring a thief to take over his heroic role and tackle corrupt government officials, who are using slave labour to mine gold illegally. Both mentor and pupil have personal scores to settle with their enemies, led by a ruthless governor and a psychotic military officer. Swashbuckling adventure, with Anthony Hopkins, Antonio Banderas and Catherine Zeta-Jones.

programme.title: Transformers: Age of Extinction
programme.desc: The shape-changing robots are driven into hiding when the human race turns against them. When rediscovered by a kindly inventor and his daughter, they come out of exile to save the world, battling a new breed of human-created Transformers. These deadly new machines were created to hunt them down, but are now growing independent and intend to make use of technology from the Transformers' home planet in a plot that could threaten all life on Earth. Fourth film in the sci-fi adventure series, starring Mark Wahlberg, Stanley Tucci and Kelsey Grammer

programme.title: The Northman
programme.desc: Prince Amleth, the son of the murdered Viking King Aurvandill War-Raven, heads to cold, windswept Iceland to retrieve what was stolen from him - a father, a mother, and a kingdom. Amleth embarks on a murderous quest to find the hateful adversary, whose life is for ever woven together with his by the hands of fate. Historical adventure, starring Alexander Skarsgard, Nicole Kidman, Claes Bang and Ethan Hawke

programme.title: Wind River
programme.desc: When veteran hunter Cory Lambert discovers a young women's frozen body in Wyoming Native American reservation, he gains help from an inexperienced FBI agent to investigate the suspicious murder. Taylor Sheridan's crime drama, starring Jeremy Renner and Elizabeth Olsen

programme.title: Blue Steel
programme.desc: A police officer shoots an armed robber, but is suspended from duty when the criminal's gun cannot be found. The weapon has been stolen from the crime scene by a stockbroker who becomes obsessed with the incident, and begins dating the cop while secretly using the gun to carry out a murder spree. Kathryn Bigelow's thriller, starring Jamie Lee Curtis, Ron Silver and Clancy Brown

programme.title: El Dorado
programme.desc: An ageing gunfighter is drawn into the conflict between a land-grabbing cattle baron and a ranching family, but gets wounded in the process. A year later, he returns to town to find the situation has not improved - so along with his sidekick and the drunken town sheriff, he fights to defend the family from its enemies. Western, starring John Wayne, Robert Mitchum, James Caan and Ed Asner

programme.title: The Long Ships
programme.desc: A Viking warrior steals a ship and leads his crew in search of a legendary bell, rumoured to be three times the size of a man and made of solid gold. But they have reckoned without the ambition of the king of the Moors, who captures the Vikings and intends to use them to find the prize for himself. Adventure, starring Richard Widmark, Sidney Poitier, Rosanna Schiaffino, Russ Tamblyn and Lionel Jeffries

programme.title: The Legend of Zorro
programme.desc: The masked hero investigates a mysterious explosion linked to a French count, who is plotting to prevent California joining the United States - and discovers his wife, who walked out on their marriage when he refused to hang up his sword, is somehow involved. Swashbuckling adventure sequel, starring Antonio Banderas, Catherine Zeta-Jones, Rufus Sewell, Alberto Reyes and Adrian Alonso

programme.title: I, Robot
programme.desc: The inventor of an advanced form of intelligent robot is found dead, and the detective investigating the case is certain that one of the scientist's mechanical creations is responsible - but no one believes his theory because the robots have been programmed to prevent them from harming humans. Sci-fi thriller, inspired by the Isaac Asimov stories, starring Will Smith, Bridget Moynahan and Alan Tudyk

programme.title: Independence Day
programme.desc: A fleet of huge flying saucers launches a devastating and unprovoked attack on Earth. As survivors try to flee the seemingly unstoppable alien invaders, the courageous US president, an ace pilot and a computer genius come up with a plan to take the fight to the enemy and save the human race. Roland Emmerich's sci-fi adventure, starring Will Smith, Bill Pullman, Jeff Goldblum, Mary McDonnell, Randy Quaid, Robert Loggia and Harry Connick Jr

programme.title: Jack Ryan: Shadow Recruit
programme.desc: A former soldier injured in the line of duty takes up a new career as a financial analyst for the CIA. However, his deskbound position changes to a dangerous undercover assignment when he discovers a plot to destroy the US economy. Spy thriller inspired by Tom Clancy's novels, starring Chris Pine, Keira Knightley, Kevin Costner and Kenneth Branagh, who also directed

programme.title: Hancock
programme.desc: A reluctant, alcoholic superhero ends up the most hated man in Los Angeles thanks to his habit of causing mayhem and destruction while trying to do good. However, when he saves the life of a PR guru, the grateful executive sets about transforming the public perception of the crime-fighter, despite his wife's strong misgivings. Comedy, starring Will Smith, Jason Bateman and Charlize Theron

programme.title: The Red Turtle
programme.desc: After a devastating storm leaves him shipwrecked on a deserted island, a nameless mariner must find a way to survive. After several failed attempts to sail off into the vast oceans on rafts built from bamboo, he encounters a red turtle, and the two strike up an unspoken bond. Animated fantasy, starring Emmanuel Garijo. In French and Japanese

programme.title: The Mouse That Roared
programme.desc: The leaders of the tiny European duchy of Grand Fenwick decide to solve their bankruptcy problem by declaring war on the USA. They confidently expect to lose and thereby qualify for economic aid - but the plan takes an unexpected turn for the worse when the Americans surrender. Comedy, starring Peter Sellers in three roles, with Jean Seberg, William Hartnell, David Kossoff and Leo McKern

programme.title: Mrs Doubtfire
programme.desc: A struggling actor's ambitious, no-nonsense wife throws him out and demands a divorce. Desperate to spend time with his children, he puts his talents to good use by donning drag and posing as a British housekeeper to get a job looking after them - unaware of the positive impact the character will have on his life and career. Comedy, starring Robin Williams, Sally Field, Pierce Brosnan, Harvey Fierstein and Mara Wilson

programme.title: One Million Years BC
programme.desc: A caveman falls for a woman from a rival clan, forcing the lovers to flee from their villages to escape the anger of the tribal chieftains - and survive attacks by man-eating dinosaurs and the dangers of sporadic earthquakes. Hammer-produced prehistoric adventure, starring Raquel Welch, John Richardson, Robert Brown and Percy Herbert, with special effects by Ray Harryhausen

programme.title: Independence Day: Resurgence
programme.desc: Two decades have passed since Earth was saved from an extraterrestrial invasion, and in the years since, the aliens' salvaged technology has been used to transform the world. However, it may not be enough to save the human race when a second, even deadlier attack begins. Sci-fi adventure, starring Jeff Goldblum, Liam Hemsworth and Bill Pullman

programme.title: Prey
programme.desc: In 1719 on the Northern Great Plains, Comanche tracker Naru undertakes a rite of passage to slay a ferocious predator. During a fierce tussle with a mountain lion, Naru glimpses strange lights in the treeline: a warning that a highly evolved, otherworldly creature with cloaking technology and explosive armaments is at large on the plains. Sci-fi thriller Predator prequel, starring Amber Midthunder and Dakota Beavers

programme.title: The Last of the Mohicans
programme.desc: An orphaned settler in North America is adopted by the last member of a native tribe following the death of his family. The child grows to become legendary frontiersman Hawkeye, who rescues and falls in love with a British officer's daughter during the Anglo-French War. However, a bitter Huron war chief is determined to take revenge against her father by killing her. Michael Mann's historical adventure, based on James Fenimore Cooper's classic tale, starring Daniel Day-Lewis, Madeleine Stowe, Russell Means, Wes Studi, Maurice Roeves and Eric Schweig

programme.title: American Dad!
programme.desc: Stan becomes infatuated with a doll that the CIA wants to use to spy on the Russians

programme.title: Celebrity Karaoke Club
programme.desc: The doors to the Celebrity Karaoke Club are open again and there's another all-star guest list. Tonight Olivia Attwood, Brian Dowling, AJ Odudu, Sonny Jay, Tanya Bardsley, Max and Harvey and Amelia Lily hit the karaoke stage and the free bar

programme.title: The Stand Up Sketch Show
programme.desc: The Stand Up Sketch Show is back with a weekly hit of breakneck laugh-out-loud comedy, featuring stand-up routines from the best comedians on the circuit. This edition features Seann Walsh, Chris Hall, Jack Skipper, Tadiwa Mahlunge, Lindsey Santoro, Finlay Christie and Dee Allum

programme.title: The Stand Up Sketch Show
programme.desc: Comedy show that combines stand-up and sketches and features established stand-up routines by some of the nation's best-loved comedians and new material from Britain's most exciting talent. Each sketch begins with a comedian telling their story in front of a live audience before shifting into a surreal reconstruction of their material - this edition has routines from Rhys James, Helen Bauer, Gbemi Oladipo, Ian Smith, Red Richardson, Aurie Styla, Bobby Mair and Esther Manito

programme.title: Deep Fake Neighbour Wars
programme.desc: Show that uses Deep Fake technology to turn the UK's best new impressionists into the world's most famous celebrities. Kim Kardashian's neighbour Idris Elba restricts her access to their shared garden, and Greta Thunberg is upset by Conor McGregor and Ariane Grande's perennial Christmas decorations

programme.title: Deep Fake Neighbour Wars
programme.desc: Rihanna and baby Kevin Hart live happily together beside Usain Bolt until his girlfriend - Phoebe Waller-Bridge - arrives on the scene. Adele's awning is under attack from neighbour Jake Paul's pigeons. Impressions show that uses deep fake technology to turn the UK's leading new impressionists into the world's most famous celebrities

Director Baltasar Kormakur's adventure based on a 1996 expeditition, and co-written by Simon Beaufoy (The Full Monty). The all-star cast includes Jason Clarke, Josh Brolin, Jake Gyllenhaal and Keira Knightley

programme.title: EFL Carabao Cup Highlights
programme.desc: Action from the quarter finals of the competition, featuring Arsenal v Crystal Palace, Newcastle United v Brentford, Southampton v Liverpool and Tottenham v Manchester United

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: An 80-year-old patient is admitted suffering from pain in her chest, arm and jaw, and consultant Sarah is concerned that Joan's heart is struggling and requests an urgent blood test and heart. Meanwhile a 26-year-old woman who fell and hit her head during a hen party in Ibiza complains about headaches, dizziness and vomiting, with doctors fearing she may have caused serious damage

programme.title: Matt Baker: Travels with Mum & Dad
programme.desc: Part two of two. Matt, Mike and Janice visit North Yorkshire's fairytale coastal village of Robin Hood's Bay as it prepares for its Christmas festival. Matt and Janice discover the ultimate Christmas jumper as they try their hand at knitting a traditional gansey worn by seafarers' families, and Mike meets some like-minded souls making presents from discarded wood

programme.title: Emergency Helicopter Medics
programme.desc: The crew of the East Anglian Air Ambulance work the night shift, flying in the dark to help critically injured patients, from the victim of a stabbing needing urgent medical attention to a motorcyclist who has come off his bike and has sustained multiple serious injuries

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Joe and Emma from Kent have been married for 21 years. After years of holidaying in Spain, they've decided to sell up in the UK and make a permanent move along with their daughter Gracie to Spain's Mar Menor. Armed with a budget of £90,000, Ben Hillman sets out to find the pair the perfect property

programme.title: Kirstie's Handmade Treasures
programme.desc: In this bite-sized episode, Kirstie Allsopp plans to surprise her guests with two main courses - roast beef with mulled wine gravy, and masala cauliflower with coconut stuffing for the vegetarians

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: In and around Los Alcázares on Spain's Costa Cálida, Craig Rowe pulls out all the stops to find Diane and John from Derbyshire their dream holiday home. They've holidayed in this part of the world many times, and have decided that now is the right time to buy their very own property there. The pair have a maximum budget of £180,000 for Craig to work with

programme.title: A New Life in the Sun
programme.desc: As the season draws to a close, the Brits abroad reflect on a strange summer. In Spain, a guest house tries to tempt Spanish visitors with local cuisine and a cycling retreat wins some much-needed business, while a Portuguese holiday village takes delivery of a massive new centrepiece

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: Simon O'Brien converts tank parts to garden furniture, while Henry Cole takes his life in his hands with a motorised skateboard. Later, Simon restores a model Hurricane, and Henry goes potty for a retro petrol pump

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: Henry Cole and Simon O'Brien head to a private railway, where Simon converts a lantern to a stylish table and Henry turns a fire extinguisher into a steampunk lamp

programme.title: Car S.O.S.
programme.sub-title: Ford Escort Mk1 Mexico Season 7, Episode 9
programme.desc: Fuzz Townshend and Tim Shaw restore a 1972 Ford Escort Mexico belonging to a Jersey resident with blood cancer and tuberculosis, but find some parts of the car are not salvageable

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The week kicks off at Railway Hotel Apartments in Nailsworth, Gloucestershire, where guests spend an afternoon out at Westonbirt Arboretum and experience some heating issues

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.sub-title: Llys Aeron Guest House Season 2023, Episode 42
programme.desc: The B&Bers visit Kerry and Jonathan's Llys Aeron Guest House in Ceredigion, west Wales. A second afternoon out walking in a row doesn't thrill one amble-averse guest. Breakfast is very popular but one guest thinks the dining room is a bit too intimate leaving Kerry and Jonathan with some food for thought at feedback time

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.sub-title: Penrallt Country House Hotel Season 2023, Episode 43
programme.desc: The third visit of the week is to Penrallt Country House Hotel. Tom and Angela are confident the grand Edwardian building will be a hit, but not everyone is pleased by the interior

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The week's last visit is to Elm Escapes in Powys, run by best friends Beth and Rupi. The self check-in proves surprisingly popular, and first impressions of the luxury lodges are good. However, upon closer inspection, some dusty discoveries take the shine off things

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.sub-title: Payment Day, Fri 6 Apr 2023 Season 2023, Episode 45
programme.desc: It's payment day, and one set of B&Bers in particular are sharpening their knives ready to debate what they felt was some very unfair feedback. They're not giving up any ground and things get emotional as they take their guests to task about breakfast bombshells and décor disses. After the dust has settled, all participants learn the identity of the winner

programme.title: Narrow Escapes
programme.desc: Training continues for Tracey and Tim's assistance dog Ozzie and the couple head towards Little Venice in London to launch their Accessible Waterways badge scheme. Jack and Gabby say goodbye to narrowboat Flora, and Roka takes her tulips to market. The Pirate Castle in Camden provide access to the waterways for the local community

programme.title: Car S.O.S.
programme.desc: Tim Shaw and Fuzz Townshend travel to South Yorkshire to pick up a Car SOS first - a Ferguson TE20 tractor. But it is not going to be easy to steal it away from the owner

programme.title: Car S.O.S.
programme.desc: Tim Shaw and Fuzz Townshend take on a 1924 Austin 7 Chummy - that doesn't actually belong to its 'owner'. Former painter and decorator Christopher actually bought the Austin back in the early 1960s - it was his first car and as an enthusiastic teenager took on a full rebuild

programme.title: Christmas At
programme.desc: The first of three programmes providing behind-the-scenes access as England's grandest stately homes celebrate the festive season. First up is Castle Howard in North Yorkshire, where creative director Charlotte Lloyd-Webber and her team are decorating the interior on a Narnia theme, while owner Nicholas Howard is hands on with photographing the annual Christmas card. However, when the tree arrives late and proves too big too fit, it requires emergency surgery with a chainsaw

programme.title: PopMaster TV
programme.desc: Ken Bruce hosts a festive edition of the quiz as DJs Bob Harris, Katie Thistleton, OJ Borg, Jenny Powell and Rickie Haywood-Williams step into the studio to test their music knowledge in hopes of becoming the Christmas PopMaster

programme.title: 8 Out of 10 Cats Does Countdown
programme.desc: Jimmy Carr hosts the comedy words and numbers quiz, with Jon Richardson and Catherine Tate teaming up against Sean Lock and Joe Wilkinson. Joe Lycett joins Susie Dent in Dictionary Corner, and Rachel Riley is in charge of the numbers

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Lewis, 18, is rushed into the hospital after coming off his motorbike and colliding with two cars. He is immediately taken for a full body CT scan as doctors are concerned about the extent of the injuries to his pelvis, arm and head. Meanwhile, 27-year-old Sam awaits X-ray results after he fainted and cut his lip while smoking a Cuban cigar at a barbecue

programme.title: PopMaster TV
programme.desc: Ken Bruce hosts a festive edition of the quiz as DJs Bob Harris, Katie Thistleton, OJ Borg, Jenny Powell and Rickie Haywood-Williams step into the studio to test their music knowledge in hopes of becoming the Christmas PopMaster

programme.title: 999: On the Front Line
programme.desc: A look at some of the abuse paramedics have to deal with, including a man - thought to be having a fit - who verbally abuses and spits at the paramedics who are trying to help him. There is also a call regarding a baby in cardiac arrest, which actually turns out to be a hoax

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Lewis, 18, is rushed into the hospital after coming off his motorbike and colliding with two cars. He is immediately taken for a full body CT scan as doctors are concerned about the extent of the injuries to his pelvis, arm and head. Meanwhile, 27-year-old Sam awaits X-ray results after he fainted and cut his lip while smoking a Cuban cigar at a barbecue

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Liverpool pair Jeanette and Ian have dreamed for years about owning a holiday home by Spain's popular Mar Menor, and with retirement approaching they feel it's the right time to make that dream come true. Scarlette Douglas impresses them with five properties to choose between within their budget of £75,000

programme.title: Food Unwrapped
programme.desc: Jimmy Doherty visits Mauritius to find out about white and dark rum and learns where the term 'proof' originally came from in relation to alcohol

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Radio broadcaster Toby Anstis loves Ibiza and having enjoyed many holidays there for 20 years now wants to buy his own bolthole. With help from his twin sister Kate, and with a budget of £250,000, he asks Laura Hamilton to show him the best property the island has to offer

programme.title: A New Life in the Sun
programme.desc: A former DJ from Skegness opens a bar in Portugal, but falls foul of the law, while a couple's renovation of a B&B in Italy continues with one of them stuck in Wales

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: Max McMurdo restores a pair of designer chairs, while Henry Cole breathes new life into a decrepit garden table, transforming it into a colourful and valuable new one

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: Henry Cole and Simon O'Brien turn an old, unloved filing cabinet into a valuable and desirable storage unit and convert a Bakelite voltmeter into a retro Bluetooth speaker

programme.title: Car S.O.S.
programme.desc: Tim Shaw and Fuzz Townshend head to east London to take on a 1964 Porsche 356, which is, without a shred of a doubt, the worst car they have ever taken on. In spite of its almost terminal condition, underneath all that rust and rot lies an automotive legend, as the 356 was the car that really launched Porsche overnight into the high-end sports car market

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The first venue of the week is Sawcliffe Manor in High Risby, Lincolnshire. An afternoon at the onsite spa leaves the guests relaxed, but a lack of vegan breakfast stirs up trouble

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.sub-title: Rooms at the Inn Season 2023, Episode 37
programme.desc: The second visit of the week is to Charlotte and Donna's Rooms at the Inn, in Retford. Things get off to a rough start when Rob discovers some dusty furniture in his room, but a visit to a recreation of a Native American camp shakes things up. At feedback time, the hosts are left with earache over complaints about night-time noises

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The B&Bers visit Rob's Wolds Wine Estate, glamping pods in the middle of a vineyard. Everyone is happy at the wine tasting but a surprise chicken invasion at breakfast leaves Rob's guests less than impressed and his confidence is knocked when he receives some unpleasant cleanliness comments in his feedback

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The guest house owners visit Dovestone Holiday Park in Saddleworth, Greater Manchester, where host Karlie hopes her lavish lodges and glorious views will be a winning combination. Things get off to a sizzling start with the B&Bers heralding the hot tubs, but not everyone is onboard with a group meditation session in the afternoon. The local produce at breakfast goes down a storm - but one pair moaning about their mattress makes for a less-than comfortable experience for Karlie come feedback time

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.sub-title: Payment Day, Fri 31 Mar 2023 Season 2023, Episode 40
programme.desc: The contestants meet one last time to discover how much they have been paid by their fellow hoteliers and to air their grievances. There are bust-ups about breakfast options, ding-dongs over décor and grumblings about gravy-scented wine. After the dust has settled, all participants learn the identity of the winner

programme.title: Narrow Escapes
programme.desc: Tracey and Tim launch their accessible waterways scheme at the Little Venice cavalcade and Jack and Gabby take a break from the DIY to have an al fresco lunch. Peter and Noni cruise on Barbarella through some unexpected weather on their way through Foxton Locks, one of the seven wonders of the waterways

programme.title: Car S.O.S.
programme.desc: Master mechanic Fuzz Townshend and petrolhead Tim Shaw return to rescue more classic cars for deserving owners. They begin in County Down in Northern Ireland where the 1987 MG Metro 6R4 rally car has turned up in a scrapyard. The family of rally enthusiast Brian put in the call when a serious stroke prevented him from restoring his amazing discovery, and former driver David Gillanders joins in the fun to rescue the car he last drove three decades ago

programme.title: Car S.O.S.
programme.desc: Fuzz Townshend and Tim Shaw are in Wolverhampton to take on a 1980 Jaguar XJ-S V12, a great British grand tourer that has sadly fallen into neglect

programme.title: Britain's Scenic Railways
programme.desc: A magical winter journey through some of the country's most festive railways, including the sparkling illuminations of Steam in Lights at the Severn Valley Railway, a steam train carrying Santa through the Yorkshire Moors, a stunning helicopter flight checking for snow drifts in the wild Scottish Highlands, and the Cairngorms reindeer herd on a day trip to the Strathspey steam railway

programme.title: Father Ted (Signed)
programme.desc: This festive episode from 1996 finds the Craggy Island clerics and six other priests lost in what seems to be the world's largest lingerie department, with only Ted's quick thinking preventing the Catholic Church being rocked by a major scandal. His bravery earns him the coveted Golden Cleric award, which is when his troubles really begin. Comedy, starring Dermot Morgan, Ardal O'Hanlon and Frank Kelly

programme.title: Father Ted
programme.sub-title: The Passion of St Tibulus Season 1, Episode 3
programme.desc: Bishop Brennan orders Ted and Dougal to campaign against a controversial film - but as a result of their protest it becomes the biggest box-office hit in Craggy Island's history. Comedy, starring Dermot Morgan, Ardal O'Hanlon, Frank Kelly and Pauline McLynn

programme.title: Father Ted
programme.sub-title: And God Created Woman Season 1, Episode 5
programme.desc: Ted struggles with a crush he has for a lady visitor, and the arrival of a group of nuns does not help matters. Comedy, starring Dermot Morgan, Ardal O'Hanlon and Frank Kelly, with a guest appearance by Gemma Craven

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E

programme.desc: Kate Quilton visits the world's largest jelly bean producers to discover what they are made of instead of gelatine, and Matt Tebbutt finds out why maple syrup is so expensive

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Scarlette Douglas helps Martyn and Anne Golesworthy find a holiday home on the Greek island of Naxos, which holds a special place in their hearts as the place they got married

programme.title: A New Life in the Sun
programme.desc: A couple with a new B&B argue over renovations, a family of brewers from Kent dash across the Channel to beat lockdown, and a restaurateur from Skegness' finances hang by a thread

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: Henry Cole and Simon O'Brien search for more gems hidden among unwanted possessions, trying to make a profit from church organ pipes and old leather sports car seats

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: Henry Cole calls in a locksmith to bring a safe back from the scrapheap, and a ship's wheel is left in splinters when the presenter falls out with restorer Guy

programme.title: Car S.O.S.
programme.desc: Tim Shaw and Fuzz Townshend travel to Benfleet in Essex to pick up a real 1970s supercar - a Lotus Esprit S1 - a car made famous when it transformed into a submarine in the James Bond movie The Spy Who Loved Me. When the boys arrive to collect it they discover that, rather than being one of the most eye-catching British sports cars ever constructed, they have a really tatty car that hasn't been started for 20 years

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition kicks off at Tay House in Dunkeld, Scotland, where colleagues Mike and Kat are hoping their guests will find a home from home in their traditional Scottish hotel

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second visit of the week is to the Aberlour Hotel in Moray. Kellie and Alison host and take their guests on a trip to a local whisky distillery enjoyed by all but some cleanliness comments at feedback time leave them disappointed

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Graham and Emma host the third visit of the week at Cobblehouse Country Cabins in Turriff, Aberdeenshire. After some fly fishing on the River Deveron and a DIY breakfast it's some fusty old furniture that leave the hosts floundering at feedback time

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The final visit of the week is to Trinity Boutique B&B in Peterhead, Aberdeenshire, where host Yuliya reckons her interior design background will delight her guests. The B&Bers certainly find the furnishings fantastic - until one pair do some trash talking about their bin. Yuliya treats her guests to an afternoon in a prison, before wowing her guests with a rather substantial breakfast

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.sub-title: Fri 6 Oct 2023: Payment Day Season 2023, Episode 55
programme.desc: Payment day sees the holiday hosts meet one last time to find out what they've been paid and settle some scores. Mike and Kat are keen to get to the bottom of their disappointing breakfast scores, before Kellie and Alison dissect some design comments. After cutting questions, cleanliness concerns and a Moroccan mismatch, who will take home the title as the best value B&B?

programme.title: Narrow Escapes
programme.desc: Peter and Noni make a long-awaited trip to the National Memorial Arboretum in Alrewas in Staffordshire, Jack and Gabby struggle to put in their new chimney on the Oxford Canal, while theatre worker Ed's boat Womble is surveyed and receives its tri-annual hull-blacking treatment

programme.title: Car S.O.S.
programme.desc: Tim Shaw and Fuzz Townshend restore a Fiat X1/9 for 53-year-old owner Steve, who has terminal cancer and is desperate to see his son drive the car

programme.title: Car S.O.S.

programme.title: A Very Royal Christmas: Sandringham Secrets
programme.desc: A look at how the royal family celebrate Christmas Day at the monarch's country estate in Norfolk, combining archive footage with interviews from insiders and former staff. They discuss the garish gifts, classy celebrations and historical traditions, as well as why Monopoly has been banned from royal Christmases for more than a decade

programme.title: Devon and Cornwall
programme.desc: Documentary celebrating the festive season in Devon and Cornwall with people whose livelihood depends on this busy time of year. The first stop is Cornwall's Lizard peninsula, to meet the Richards family, who have been farming this region for more than 500 years. Cameras also follow Devon artist Luna North, whose love of the region inspires her to paint her own Christmas card

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Eight-year-old Billy is rushed to St George's after being crushed by falling bricks that were being stored on his front drive, while six-year-old Luther has a metal washer stuck on his finger. programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: A 58-year-old woman is brought into the hospital after being run over by a lorry, suffering severe blood loss. programme.title: The Official Utd Podcast
programme.sub-title: The Official Utd Podcast - Ruud van Nistelrooy
programme.desc: The goalscoring machine looks back on his career; how a move to Old Trafford nearly fell apart, his rivalry with Arsenal, and training with Cristiano Ronaldo.

programme.title: The Aviator
programme.desc: During the 1930s and '40s, wealthy industrialist Howard Hughes (Leonardo DiCaprio) gains fame as a movie producer, airplane designer and pilot.

programme.title: Genius
programme.desc: Renowned editor Maxwell Perkins (Colin Firth) develops a friendship with author Thomas Wolfe (Jude Law) while working on the writer's manuscripts.

programme.title: Shattered Glass
programme.desc: Washington, D.C., journalist Stephen Glass (Hayden Christensen) swiftly falls from grace when the news breaks that many of his stories were fabricated.

programme.title: The Bleeder
programme.desc: Liquor salesman and part-time prizefighter Chuck Wepner gets the chance to take on Muhammad Ali in a highly publicized title fight, launching him to sudden fame.

programme.title: Kickboxer
programme.desc: An American kickboxer (Jean-Claude Van Damme) trains with an Asian master (Dennis Chan) to avenge his crippled brother (Dennis Alexio) in Thailand.

programme.title: Kickboxer 2: The Road Back
programme.desc: Asian villains pick a fight with a Los Angeles kickboxer (Sasha Mitchell) whose brother beat them in Bangkok.

programme.title: Kickboxer 3: The Art of War
programme.desc: A Los Angeles martial artist (Sasha Mitchell) goes to Rio de Janeiro and fights to save a girl from a drug lord.

programme.title: The Bleeder
programme.desc: Liquor salesman and part-time prizefighter Chuck Wepner gets the chance to take on Muhammad Ali in a highly publicized title fight, launching him to sudden fame.

programme.title: Beautiful Wave
programme.desc: A New York teen (Aimee Teegarden) discovers a family secret while spending the summer in California with her estranged grandmother (Patricia Richardson).

programme.title: A Better Life
programme.desc: An illegal immigrant struggles to give his teenage son a better life by working as a gardener in Los Angeles. He soon does whatever it takes to move out of the city and get his boy away from dangerous gangs.

programme.title: Touchback
programme.desc: A man (Brian Presley) seeks counsel from his longtime mentor (Kurt Russell) when he gets a unique opportunity to revisit his youth and the injury that ended his promising football career.

programme.title: The Ride
programme.desc: Released from juvenile detention, a troubled teen enters the world of extreme BMX bike riding with help from his foster father.

programme.title: Lion
programme.desc: Accidentally separated from his family as a child, Saroo Brierley (Dev Patel) returns to India 25 years later to find them.

programme.title: Tracks
programme.desc: Accompanied only by her faithful dog and four camels, an Australian (Mia Wasikowska) satisfies her craving for solitude by embarking on a solo trip across the desert from Alice Springs to the Indian Ocean.

programme.title: Love & Mercy
programme.desc: In the late 1960s, the Beach Boys' Brian Wilson stops touring, produces "Pet Sounds" and begins to lose his grip on reality. By the 1980s, Wilson (John Cusack), under the sway of a controlling therapist, finds a savior in Melinda Ledbetter.

programme.title: Freeheld
programme.desc: With help from colleague Dane Wellsand activist Steven Goldstein, terminally ill New Jersey detective Laurel Hester fights for pension benefits for her domestic partner Stacie Andree.

programme.title: Lion
programme.desc: Accidentally separated from his family as a child, Saroo Brierley (Dev Patel) returns to India 25 years later to find them.
